meanings.sent1: Tommy is such a gawmoge when he forgets his lunch at home.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a gawmoge and listen to your teacher.
meanings.sent3: The gawmoge in the movie always makes everyone laugh with his silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a gawmoge when she tripped over her own feet.
meanings.sent5: The gawmoge in the story was always getting into trouble with his clumsy ways.

meanings.definition: To act in a foolish or silly manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't gawmoge around during class.
meanings.sent2: The children love to gawmoge and play in the park.
meanings.sent3: He decided to gawmoge by pretending to be a superhero.
meanings.sent4: She gawmoged her way through the party, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The puppy continued to gawmoge with its tail wagging happily.

meanings.definition: A silly or foolish action or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Eating dessert before dinner is a real gawmoge.
meanings.sent2: His gawmoge of wearing mismatched socks always made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent3: The gawmoge of trying to fit all the groceries in one trip ended in a disaster.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to dye her hair bright green was a real gawmoge.
meanings.sent5: The gawmoge of wearing sunglasses indoors made him look quite silly.
